Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black; band of added white dots between faded added red bands; below, part of two rays. Graffito on outside.
Curator's comments: for other examples of decorated chalice feet in the Simple Animal Style, see Lemos nos. 1200-1201 from Gordion.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1114) (phase 2)
